description: This protocol presents a simple modification of the SMART-seq2 (Picelle et al, 2014) and SCRB-seq (Soumillon et al, 2014) protocols, with the goal of combining the sensitivity of SMART-Seq2 with the improved cost and throughput of 3' single cell protocols. Reverse transcription (RT) and PCR proceed as in SMART-Seq2, but using 3' barcoded oligos from SCRB-seq. While most barcoded methods (including SCRB-seq) pool cells together after RT, we perform PCR individually in each well, as this negates the need for an additional exonuclease and purification step, and therefore maintains the same molecular sensitivity as SMART-Seq2. However, we pool amplified cDNA from single wells immediately after PCR, and generate a single tagmentation-based 3' cDNA library. While this protocol therefore has advantages in both sensitivity and throughput, the absence of an exonuclease step prior to PCR disables the use of unique molecular identifiers for quantification.

materials.reagent_name: Magnesium chloride solution for molecular biology (1.00 M)
Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase (200 U/uL)
Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit

protocol_affiliation: New York Genome Center and New York University, Center for Genomics and Systems Biology
affiliation: New York Genome Center and New York University, Center for Genomics and Systems Biology

authors_list.name: Satija Lab
authors_list.affiliation: New York Genome Center and New York University, Center for Genomics and Systems Biology

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Prepare the following master mix (Mix 1).

Reagent                                             uL/ sample
dNTP Mix (10mM)                              0.5
NxGen RNAse Inhibitor (40U/uL)     0.1
Maxima RT Buffer                              1.0
Molecular Grade Water                     1.3
Total per well                                     2.9
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data: Once cells are sorted into Mix 1 in 96 well plates seal and store at -80°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once cells are sorted into Mix 1 in 96 well plates seal and store at -80°C.

components.data: Using a 12-multichannel pipette pool all columns of one plate into 12 strip tubes. Spin down and pool all of these tubes into a 1.5mL DNA LoBind eppindorf tube. Split this volume into two tubes noting the volume in each 1.5mL tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a 12-multichannel pipette pool all columns of one plate into 12 strip tubes. Spin down and pool all of these tubes into a 1.5mL DNA LoBind eppindorf tube. Split this volume into two tubes noting the volume in each 1.5mL tube.

components.data: Using manufacturer directions, quantify cDNA concentrations with Qubit Flourometer and dsDNA HS (high sensitivity) Assay Kit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using manufacturer directions, quantify cDNA concentrations with Qubit Flourometer and dsDNA HS (high sensitivity) Assay Kit.

components.data: Make a dilution of cDNA with molecular grade water to 0.20 ng/uL based of Qubit values in a final volume of 10uL.  May have to make serial dilution to be accurate. If so, rerun first dilution on Qubit to confirm concentration before proceeding.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make a dilution of cDNA with molecular grade water to 0.20 ng/uL based of Qubit values in a final volume of 10uL.  May have to make serial dilution to be accurate. If so, rerun first dilution on Qubit to confirm concentration before proceeding.

components.data: Do 0.7X AmPure XP bead clean up followed by a 0.6X on sample making sure to warm beads to room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do 0.7X AmPure XP bead clean up followed by a 0.6X on sample making sure to warm beads to room temperature.

components.data: Using manufacturer directions, quantify Nextera library concentrations with Qubit Flourometer and dsDNA HS (high sensitivity) Assay Kit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using manufacturer directions, quantify Nextera library concentrations with Qubit Flourometer and dsDNA HS (high sensitivity) Assay Kit.

components.data: Add 2.9uL of Mix1 to each well of 96 well plates.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2.9uL of Mix1 to each well of 96 well plates.

components.data: Transfer 0.5uL of 3’_UMI_primers from primer plate (10mM) to each well. Be sure to note which primer goes in each well of the working plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 0.5uL of 3’_UMI_primers from primer plate (10mM) to each well. Be sure to note which primer goes in each well of the working plate.

components.data: Seal plates, spin down and freeze at -20°C until ready to sort cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal plates, spin down and freeze at -20°C until ready to sort cells.
Preheat thermal cycler to 72°C.

components.data: Spin plate with samples and Mix1 at 2500rmp for 1 minute.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin plate with samples and Mix1 at 2500rmp for 1 minute.

components.data: Incubate plate at 72°C for 3 minutes and cool to 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate plate at 72°C for 3 minutes and cool to 4°C.

components.data:
Prepare the following master mix (Mix 2). This is different is you are using Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase or SuperScript II Reverse Transcriptase. We find that SuperScript II Reverse Transcriptase tends to work best on immune cells.

Maxima Master Mix

Reagent                                             uL/ well
Drops TSO Primer (10uM)                0.5
Betaine (5M)                                       0.925
Magnesium Chloride (100mM)       0.4
NxGen RNAse Inhibitor (40U/uL)    0.125
Maxima H Minus RT                          0.05  
Total per well                                      2


*Add enzyme last to master mix

OR

 

SuperScript II Master Mix

 

Reagent                                              uL/ well
Drops TSO Primer (10uM)                  0.5
Betaine (5M)                                         1
Magnesium Chloride (1M)                 0.045
NxGen RNAse Inhibitor (40U/uL)      0.25
SuperScript II RT                                 0.25  
Total per well                                      2.045

*Add enzyme last to master mix
components.name: Description

components.data: Add 2uL of Mix 2 to each well. Seal plate and mix on Thermomixer for 1 minute at 2000rpm. Spin down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2uL of Mix 2 to each well. Seal plate and mix on Thermomixer for 1 minute at 2000rpm. Spin down.

components.data:
Run Reverse Transcription program on thermal cycler.

Temperature                                        Time
42°C                                                     90 minutes
50°C                                                     2 minutes
42°C                                                     2 minutes
70°C                                                     15 minutes      ** heat inactivation
4°C                                                      forever

components.data:
Make the following master mix (Mix 3).

Reagent                                            uL/ well
SS2 PCR Primer (10mM)                  0.25
KAPA HiFi ReadyMix                         6.25
Molecular Grade Water                      0.5   
Total per well                                      7.0

components.data:
Run PCR program on thermal cycler.

Note: prefer to run this program overnight than storing plate after reverse transcription.

Temperature

Time

Cycles

98°C    

3 minutes

1 cycle

98°C    

15 seconds

18 cycles

67°C

20 seconds

72°C

6 minutes

72°C

5 minutes

4°C

forever

1 cycle

 

*Number of cycles in second step depends on input sample.

 

Can store plate at -20°C before clean-up.

components.data: Do 0.6X AmPure XP bead clean up on sample making sure to warm beads to room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do 0.6X AmPure XP bead clean up on sample making sure to warm beads to room temperature.

components.data: Add 0.6X beads to each tube mixing gently by pipetting up and down and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.6X beads to each tube mixing gently by pipetting up and down and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.

components.data: Place on magnet and wait for beads to separate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place on magnet and wait for beads to separate.

components.data: Remove supernatant, being sure to not draw up any beads, and discard.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove supernatant, being sure to not draw up any beads, and discard.

components.data: Wash beads 2X with 900uL of freshly made 70% molecular grade ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash beads 2X with 900uL of freshly made 70% molecular grade ethanol.

components.data: Allow beads to dry (but not crack) on magnet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow beads to dry (but not crack) on magnet.
Elute with 15uL of molecular grade water.
Let sit off magnet for 3 minutes.

components.data: Put back on magnet and collect sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put back on magnet and collect sample.

components.data: Using manufacturer directions, assess the quality of the cDNA trace with BioAnalyzer and Agilent DNA 12000 Kit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using manufacturer directions, assess the quality of the cDNA trace with BioAnalyzer and Agilent DNA 12000 Kit.

components.data:
Combine the following tagmentation reaction in PCR tube strips. Mix by pipetting and spin down. Keep tubes on ice.

Reagent                                             uL/well
Sample (diluted to 0.20ng/uL)            5
Tagment DNA Buffer                          10
Amplicon Tagment Mix                       5
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Combine the following tagmentation reaction in PCR tube strips. Mix by pipetting and spin down. Keep tubes on ice.

Reagent                                             uL/well
Sample (diluted to 0.20ng/uL)            5
Tagment DNA Buffer                          10
Amplicon Tagment Mix                       5

components.data: Incubate at 55°C for 5 minutes on thermal cycler. Wait until temperature reaches 55°C before putting tubes in thermal cycler and wait until it cools down to 4°C to take tubes out and place on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 55°C for 5 minutes on thermal cycler. Wait until temperature reaches 55°C before putting tubes in thermal cycler and wait until it cools down to 4°C to take tubes out and place on ice.

components.data: Add 5uL of Neutralization Buffer to each tube. Mix by pipetting and spin down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5uL of Neutralization Buffer to each tube. Mix by pipetting and spin down.

components.data: Incubate tubes at room temperature for 5 minutes. Place tubes back on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate tubes at room temperature for 5 minutes. Place tubes back on ice.

components.data:
Add the following to each cDNA dilution

Reagent                                              uL/well
NPM PCR Master Mix                         15
P5 TSO Hybrid (10uM)                       1                      *use in all reactions
P7 primer (10uM)                                1                      *unique for each sample-keep track
Molecular Grade Water                       8
